forumNotes.author: Preedne
forumNotes.content: I have used WinBuilder to Build the LiveXP.iso, also, I used Windows XP SP2 OEM Retail version as the source. WinBuilder starts the Qemu, but afterwards you can only see the mouse pointer and thats it. Theres a box flashing and I can read that it says something about XPE or XPE Installation, or XPE Loading on its TitleBar with Windows XP logo below the TitleBar... Loaded it to a Flashdrive to see if it works but I get the same thing... Are there any required prerequisites, system requirements, etc, etc needed for it to run? RAM or something?

forumNotes.author: nubycakes
forumNotes.content:
If you are booting into ram then you need to ensure that the system that you are trying to run the live cd from has more than the image size avalible.

example: system memory= 512MB, Image size= 700MB, the image will only partially load. just a thought.

how are you booting it? how is the usb drive formated?

**Edited by nubycakes, 23 October 2013 - 12:06 AM.**
